description:
html: remove the Tokenizer.ReturnComments option.

The original intention was to simplify the parser, in making it skip
all comment tokens. However, checking that the Go html package is
100% compatible with the WebKit HTML test suite requires parsing the
comments. There is no longer any real benefit for the option.

messages.text:
gri is on vacation, so I'm going to submit this (and fix up the change
description).

Hello gri@golang.org (cc: andybalholm@gmail.com, golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM.

In the change description—do comments actually get reparented?

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=3cd527587035 ***

html: remove the Tokenizer.ReturnComments option.

The original intention was to simplify the parser, in making it skip
all comment tokens. However, checking that the Go html package is
100% compatible with the WebKit HTML test suite requires parsing the
comments. There is no longer any real benefit for the option.

R=gri, andybalholm
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5321043

subject: code review 5321043: html: remove the Tokenizer.ReturnComments option.
